intro: Hutera pseudoerucastrum, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas and thrives in cool, humid climates. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, with a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and somewhat branched. Hutera pseudoerucastrum is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
